org.jepria.versionizer

Interface WriteReleaseNotesAction.UserInterface

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CommonUserInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CLUI
    Enclosing class:
    WriteReleaseNotesAction

    public static interface WriteReleaseNotesAction.UserInterface
    Simple, low-level (uses primitive types for communication) user interface

      When error occured, ask whether to recover the error manually or skip writing release notes to the file
      int wrn_optReleaseNotesBlockManualCreate(java.lang.String overviewPath)
      When no releaseNotes block found in the overview file, ask whether to create it manually or to skip writing release notes for the module

    • Method Detail

      • wrn_msgReleaseNotesBlockNotFound

        void wrn_msgReleaseNotesBlockNotFound(java.lang.String overviewPath)

      • wrn_optReleaseNotesBlockManualCreate

        int wrn_optReleaseNotesBlockManualCreate(java.lang.String overviewPath)
        When no releaseNotes block found in the overview file, ask whether to create it manually or to skip writing release notes for the module
        Parameters:
        overviewPath -
        Returns:
        1: user creates releaseNotes block manually; else: skip writing release notes for the module

      • wrn_reqReleaseNotesBlockManualCreate

        void wrn_reqReleaseNotesBlockManualCreate(java.lang.String overviewPath)
        Request (and wait) the user to create Release Notes Block manually in the overview file (just an empty block)

      • wrn_optReleaseNotesExistUpdate

        int wrn_optReleaseNotesExistUpdate(java.lang.String targetVersion,
                                   java.lang.String overviewPath)
        When release notes for the target version already exist in the overview file, ask whether to auto-update existing release notes, to update them manually or to skip writing release notes for the module
        Parameters:
        targetVersion -
        overviewPath -
        Returns:
        1: auto-update existing release notes for the target version; 2: user writes release notes manually; else: skip writing release notes for the module

      • wrn_reqReleaseNotesExistWriteManually

        void wrn_reqReleaseNotesExistWriteManually(java.lang.String targetVersion,
                                           java.lang.String overviewPath)

                                   java.lang.String overviewPath)

      • wrn_optRecoverErrorOrSkip

        int wrn_optRecoverErrorOrSkip()
        When error occured, ask whether to recover the error manually or skip writing release notes to the file
        Returns:
        1: recover manually; else: skip writing release notes to the file

      • wrn_reqRecoverError

        void wrn_reqRecoverError()
        Request (and wait) the user to recover the error manually
